# **Business Glossary & Terminology**

**Project Name:** F&B Sales Tracking Dashboard

**Generated By:** @Business_Analyst

**Reference:** docs/business-context/01-BRD.md, docs/business-context/02-Business-Flow.md

---

## **1. Overview**

This document serves as the **Single Source of Truth Dictionary** for the F&B Sales Tracking Dashboard project. It aligns term perceptions between the Business team (Stakeholders) and the Technical team (Developers), ensuring consistent understanding across all documentation and code implementation.

---

## **2. Core Business Entities**

| Business Term | Definition & Usage Context | Alias Name (If Any) |
| :---- | :---- | :---- |
| **Product** | An individual item sold at the F&B store. Each product has a defined daily sales target of 10 units and is tracked for stock levels, sales, and waste. | Item, Menu Item |
| **Stock** | The current quantity of a product available for sale. Measured in units and displayed in real-time at the POS. | Inventory, Stock Count |
| **Daily Target** | The predefined sales goal for each product, set at 10 units per product per day. Also refers to the overall USD revenue goal for the day. | Sales Target, Daily Goal |
| **Revenue** | Total monetary value generated from sales, tracked in USD against predefined targets. | Sales Amount, Income |
| **Waste** | Products that are discarded due to expiration, damage, or quality issues. Logged manually with reason codes. | Spoilage, Shrinkage |
| **Transaction** | A single sales event at the POS where one or more products are purchased by a customer. | Sale, Order |
| **POS (Point of Sale)** | The existing system used to process customer transactions. The Dashboard integrates with the POS to capture sales data automatically. | Cash Register, Checkout System |
| **Dashboard** | The mobile-accessible interface where Owners and Managers view real-time sales performance, stock levels, and waste reports. | Analytics Panel, Overview Screen |
| **Reason Code** | A predefined category assigned to a waste log entry to classify the cause (e.g., Expired, Damaged, Quality Issue). | Waste Category |
| **Threshold** | The minimum stock level that triggers a low stock alert. Defined per product or as a percentage of daily target. | Reorder Point, Minimum Stock |

---

## **3. User Roles & Actors**

| Role Name | Definition & Main Access Rights |
| :---- | :---- |
| **Owner** | The business owner with full visibility into store performance. Can access the mobile dashboard to view sales, revenue, inventory, and waste reports. Cannot process transactions directly (uses Manager or Cashier for POS operations). |
| **Manager** | The store manager responsible for daily operations. Can access the mobile dashboard, respond to low stock alerts, initiate replenishment, and view all performance metrics. May also have access to waste reports for operational decision-making. |
| **Cashier** | Front-line staff responsible for processing transactions at the POS. Can view real-time stock levels on the POS screen and log waste entries. Does NOT have access to the mobile dashboard or revenue reports. |
| **Staff** | Generic term referring to any employee (Cashier or Manager) who may log waste entries or perform operational tasks. | Employee, Team Member |

---

## **4. Status & Action Terminology**

| Status/Action Name | Business Logic Definition |
| :---- | :---- |
| **Target Achieved** | A product has sold 10 or more units within the current operational day (7:00 AM – 10:00 PM). Displayed with a visual indicator (e.g., green checkmark, badge). |
| **Target In Progress** | A product has sold fewer than 10 units. Displayed with a progress bar showing percentage completion. |
| **Low Stock** | A product's remaining stock has fallen below the predefined threshold. Triggers an alert on POS and a notification to Manager's mobile. |
| **Out of Stock** | A product has zero remaining stock. Cannot be sold until replenished. Displayed on POS with visual indicator. |
| **Store Open** | The store is within operating hours (7:00 AM – 10:00 PM). Sales tracking and target monitoring are active. |
| **Store Closed** | The store is outside operating hours. Daily summary is generated; no new transactions are recorded. |
| **Waste Logged** | A waste entry has been successfully submitted, including product, quantity, and reason code. Updates waste report and may adjust stock count. |
| **Replenished** | Stock has been manually updated by the Manager after receiving new inventory. Stock count reflects the new total. |

### **4.1 Waste Reason Codes (ENUM)**

| Reason Code | Definition |
| :---- | :---- |
| **EXPIRED** | Product passed its expiration date and cannot be sold. |
| **DAMAGED** | Product was physically damaged (e.g., dropped, crushed) and cannot be sold. |
| **QUALITY_ISSUE** | Product did not meet quality standards (e.g., undercooked, wrong temperature) and was discarded. |
| **OTHER** | Any waste reason not covered by the above categories. Requires additional notes. |

---

## **5. Excluded Terms**

| Forbidden Term | Correct Term to Use | Reason |
| :---- | :---- | :---- |
| **Buyer** | Customer | "Customer" is neutral and aligns with POS terminology; "Buyer" implies a specific transactional role not used in this context. |
| **Inventory System** | Dashboard or Stock Display | "Inventory System" implies a separate standalone system; the stock display is a feature within the Dashboard integrated with POS. |
| **Order** | Transaction | "Order" may imply a customer request awaiting fulfillment; "Transaction" refers to a completed sale at the POS. |
| **Admin** | Owner or Manager | "Admin" is a technical role; use business-specific roles (Owner/Manager) to avoid confusion with system administration. |
| **Stock Take** | Physical Count | "Stock Take" implies a formal inventory audit process; use "Physical Count" for manual stock verification activities. |

---

## **6. Metric & KPI Terminology**

| Metric Name | Definition & Calculation |
| :---- | :---- |
| **Daily Target Achievement Rate** | Percentage of products that met or exceeded the 10-unit daily target. Formula: (Products Achieved / Total Products) × 100% |
| **Waste Reduction Rate** | Percentage decrease in product waste over a 30-day period. Formula: ((Previous Waste - Current Waste) / Previous Waste) × 100% |
| **Revenue Target Achievement** | Actual daily/weekly revenue divided by the USD target, expressed as a percentage. Formula: (Actual Revenue / Target Revenue) × 100% |
| **Dashboard Adoption Rate** | Percentage of active users (Owner, Manager, Cashier) who logged into the mobile dashboard at least once per shift. |
| **Stock Accuracy** | Variance between system-recorded stock and physical counts. Target: <2% variance. Formula: (|System Count - Physical Count| / Physical Count) × 100% |
